item.title: Personal
item.description: I'm originally from downstate Illinois, and have occasionally bounced around between three continents. In my free time I enjoy scuba diving, ham radio, international travel, Boccherini concertos, excellent writing (here is a reading list), and the great outdoors. Above: Curt (K7ZOO) listening to satellite transmissions from somewhere near Sonoita, Arizona, during an expedition of the K7UAZ ham radio group. Above: I taught math and physics at a secondary school somewhere in Kenya as a Peace Corps volunteer for a couple years.

item.title: Research
item.description: I am a postdoc in Jeff Chilcote's research lab at the University of Notre Dame, where I am in charge of testing and upgrading components of the Gemini Planet Imager instrument in preparation for installing it on the Gemini-North telescope in Hawaii. The motivation of this upgrade is to survey for massive planets with low initial starting entropies (i.e., cool planets), and thereby provide additional constraints on the physics of planet formation.
